meanings.definition: A tropical American plant with starchy rhizomes.
meanings.sent1: The arrowroot plant grows in warm regions and has underground stems full of starch.
meanings.sent2: I planted some arrowroot in my garden to see if it will thrive in this climate.
meanings.sent3: Why did the arrowroot plant go to school? To get a little more root-ucation!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an arrowroot plant, quietly growing in the depths of her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The arrowroot plant's rhizomes were like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A fine white powder obtained from the rhizomes of the arrowroot plant, used as a thickening agent in cooking.
meanings.sent1: I added a pinch of arrowroot to the soup to make it thicker.
meanings.sent2: Arrowroot is a great alternative to cornstarch for thickening sauces.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef accidentally spilled arrowroot all over the kitchen, creating a powdery mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like arrowroot, subtly thickening the air with unspoken tension.
meanings.sent5: The arrowroot powder danced gracefully on the surface of the simmering stew, transforming it into a velvety delight.
